member.name: T:PluginManager.BasePluginManager
member.summary: Base plugin manager, contains methods and properties to load and interact with plugins within an application

member.summary: Internal constructor, used internally by the BasePluginManager to initialise the class internals

member.param: Plugin configuration
Plugin Settings

member.name: P:PluginManager.BasePluginManager.RootPath

member.name: M:PluginManager.BasePluginManager.PluginLoading(System.Reflection.Assembly@)

member.summary: Provides an opportunity for the PluginManager descendant to post configure plugin modules, if desired.

member.summary: Provides an opportunity for the PluginManager descendant to modify the name of the resource being extracted.

member.summary: Loads and configures an individual plugin

Location of assembly on physical disk.
Determines whether resources are extracted from the plugin module or not.

member.summary: Loads and configures an individual plugin
member.param: Filename of plugin to be loaded.
If true, copies the plugin to a local temp area to load from.

member.summary: Allows plugins to configure the services for all plugins

member.name: M:PluginManager.BasePluginManager.PluginGetTypesWithAttribute``1

member.summary: Retrieves the non instantiated classes which inherit from T or implement interface T

member.name: T:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration
member.summary: Plugin Manager configuration class. Used when Initialising the Plugin Manager.

member.summary: Default constructor, uses all default settings.

member.param: Valid instance of ILogger
Valid instance of ILoadSettingsService.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.Logger
member.summary:
ILogger instance used by the AspNetCore.PluginManager and plugin modules to log information to a default log storage.
This can be within a database or file based. The standard ILogger implementation saves data to a log file.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.LoadSettingsService
member.summary: ILoadSettingsService instance is used by the AspNetCore.PluginManager to load settings and configuration data for plugins that it will load.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.CurrentPath
member.summary: Current root path of the application.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.ConfigFileName
member.summary: Configuration file name that will be used by the default implementation of ILoadSettingsService to obtain data.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.ConfigurationFile
member.summary: Configuration file name that will be used by the default implementation of ILoadSettingsService to obtain data.

member.name: M:PluginManager.PluginManagerConfiguration.ReplaceLogger(PluginManager.Abstractions.ILogger@)
member.summary: Allow the ILogger instance to be replaced, for internal use only.

member.name: T:PluginManager.LogLevel
member.summary: Log Levels, defines the type of log entry being made by ILogger interface.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.Information
member.summary: Log entry is information only.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.Warning
member.summary: Log entry is a warning condition.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Log entry represents an error that has occurred.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.Critical
member.summary: Log entry is a critical error within the system.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.PluginLoadSuccess
member.summary: Log entry is informing that a plugin module has been successfully loaded.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.PluginLoadFailed
member.summary: Log entry is informing that a plugin module has failed to load.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.PluginLoadError
member.summary: Log entry is informing that a generic error occurred when loading a plugin module.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.PluginConfigureError
member.summary: Log entry is informing that there is a configuration error with a plugin module.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.IpRestricted
member.summary: Log entry informing that an Ip address has had restriction imposed upon it within the RestrictIp.Plugin module.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.CacheControlError
member.summary: Indicates that an error occurred within CacheControl.Plugin module.

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.ThreadManager
member.summary: The event was raised by the ThreadManager

member.name: F:PluginManager.LogLevel.Localization
member.summary:
Indicates that an error occurred when translating a string using Localization.Plugin.
This is usually an indication that a localized string is missing.

member.name: T:PluginManager.DynamicLoadResult
member.summary: Result enum for dynamically adding plugin modules using IPluginHelperService interface.

member.name: F:PluginManager.DynamicLoadResult.Success
member.summary: Plugin module was dynamically added to the list of available plugins.

member.name: F:PluginManager.DynamicLoadResult.Failed
member.summary: Failed to load the module as an available plugin.

member.name: F:PluginManager.DynamicLoadResult.AlreadyLoaded
member.summary: The module was already loaded as a plugin module within the PluginManager.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.ILoadSettingsService
member.summary:
This interface is used when initially loading the AspNetCore.PluginManager to load settings it requires. A custom implementation can be supplied during initialisation of the Plugin Manager which can enable the settings to be loaded from a custom data source.
This interface will be used to load PluginSetting and PluginSettings but may be extended in future versions to include other initialisation data.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.ILoadSettingsService.LoadSettings``1(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Requests that setting data be loaded for T, this could be PluginSetting or PluginSettings.
member.param: jsonFile to use, this can be altered for custom implementations.
Name of settings to be loaded.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.ILoadSettingsService.LoadSettings``1(System.String@)
member.summary: Requests that setting data be loaded for T, this could be PluginSetting or PluginSettings, the default jsonFile name is used (appsettings.json).
member.param: Name of settings to be loaded.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.ILogger
member.summary: Generic interface provided where plugin modules and all other parts of the system can add data to a log file.

member.summary: Adds data to the log file.

Exception that was raised.

member.summary: Logs an exception with the log file and also creates an additional exception log entry detailing the exception, call stack etc.
member.param: LogLevel enum indicating the type of log entry
Additional data to be logged with the exception.

member.summary: Adds data to the log file.

Name of module creating the log entry
Data to be logged.

member.summary: Logs an exception with the log file and also creates an additional exception log entry detailing the exception, call stack etc.
member.param: LogLevel enum indicating the type of log entry
Name of module creating the log entry
Exception that was raised.

Name of module creating the log entry
Additional data to be logged with the exception.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPlugin
member.summary:
This interface should be implemented by each plugin module, without this interface being implemented AspNetCore.PluginManager would not automatically load it when the appliction starts.
This class will be called by the Plugin Manager and will provide an opportunity for the plugin to configure its services and application requirements within the MVC application.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPlugin.Initialise(PluginManager.Abstractions.ILogger)
member.summary: Notifies the plugin that the plugin module is being initialised.
member.param: ILogger instance used to hold log data, should the plugin need to log any intialisation data. Each plugin should store this instance for later use if logging is a requirement.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPlugin.Finalise
member.summary: Notifies the plugin module that it is being closed and removed and it should uninitialise any resources that it has used.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPlugin.ConfigureServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary: Provides the plugin module with an opportunity to register any services that it provides.
member.param: IServiceCollection instance where further services can be registerd.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginClassesService
member.summary:
IPluginClassesService is implemented by the AspNetCore.PluginManager and is available using DI.
This interface provides a conduit for the application or other plugins to quickly search all plugins for classes that implement or extend a specific class or interface.
This can be particularly useful if for instance you define menu items within plugins, the host can search all plugins for the menu class, and get a list of all objects, instantiated or not.
The plugin can then use the interfaces to dynamically create menu items.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginClassesService.GetPluginClasses``1
member.summary:
Retrieves a list of instantiated classes that either descend from, or implement T.
If a class requires parameters for instantiating, then they will be sought from the DI container, as long as the parameters are available then an instance of the class will be created.
member.typeparam: Class or interface to be searched for.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginClassesService.GetPluginClassTypes``1
member.summary:
Retrieves a list of classes as types, that either descend from or implement T.
This method will not create instances of the classes found, instead it will return the list and the calling module can choose how it wants to use them.
member.typeparam: Class or interface to be searched for.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginHelperService
member.summary:
Provides a mechanism for the host application or other plugin modules to query the AspNetCore.PluginManager for specific data.
This interface is implemented by the Plugin Manager and registered for use within the DI contianer when loading.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginHelperService.PluginLoaded(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines whether a plugin module has been loaded.
member.param: The name of the plugin module, i.e. SeoPlugin.dll
out int. Returns the internal plugin version of the plugin if found.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginHelperService.AddAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly@)
member.summary: Dynamically adds a non plugin assembly to the list of managed plugins.
member.param: Assembly instance of assembly to be added to the list of available plugins.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule
member.summary: Interface representing a plugin module that has been loaded using PluginManager

member.name: P:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule.Version
member.summary: Plugin version, this is the internal plugin version not the file version

member.name: P:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule.Module
member.summary: Assembly name and location

member.name: P:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule.Assembly
member.summary: Assembly instance representing the Plugin module

member.name: P:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule.Plugin
member.summary: The plugin modules IPlugin interface

member.name: P:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginModule.FileVersion
member.summary: Current version of assembly

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginTypesService
member.summary:
Allows plugin modules to retrieve a list of class Types that implement a specific attribute either at a class or method level.
None of the Types returned are instantiated instances.
This can only return Types that have been made available from within a plugin module that has been registered with AspNetCore.PluginManager.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginTypesService.GetPluginTypesWithAttribute``1
member.summary: Return a list of all class types that implement a specific attribute T at the class or method level.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginVersion
member.summary: This interface should be implemented by all plugin modules which need to specify which internal version of the AspNetCore.PluginManager is used. The default is one (1).

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.IPluginVersion.GetVersion
member.summary: Retrieves the currently supported version. If the value is outside of the valid range of internal versions that are in use, then the default one (1) is used.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.ISettingsProvider
member.summary:
This interface can be used by all plugin modules to load setting and configuration data.
The default implementation which is loaded if no other plugin registers an instance uses appsettings.json to store configuration data to be used by Plugins.
An instance of this interface is available via the DI container, any custom implementations must be configured to be used in the DI contaner when being initialised.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.ISettingsProvider.GetSettings``1(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Retrieves settings for Class T
member.typeparam: Class who's settings are being requested.
member.param: Name of storage to be used.
Name of configuration data required.
member.returns: Instance of type T initialised with the required settings.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.ISettingsProvider.GetSettings``1(System.String@)
member.summary: Retrieves settings for Class T
member.typeparam: Class who's settings are being requested.
member.param: Name of configuration data required.
member.returns: Instance of type T initialised with the required settings.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener
member.summary:
This interface is used to create instances of a class that can register themselves with INotificationService in order to receive Notifications for Inter Plugin Event Notification.
An instance of this class will only receive notifications for events to which they register to.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener.EventRaised(System.String@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: This method is used to notify registered listeners that an event has been raised and is generally used in order to obtain a response. If called then the active thread is blocked whilst processing is completed and can be used by callers to ask a question which needs a response.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined result to be passed back to the class that raised the event.
member.returns: bool. If a listener retures true, then the answer is deemed to be received and no other listeners will be called and the result will be passed straight back to the class where the event was raised. If false, the next listener in the chain will be called.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener.EventRaised(System.String@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: This method is used to notify registered listeners that an event has been raised and is generally used when no response is required. If called then the active thread is not blocked whilst processing is completed.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener.GetEvents
member.summary:
This method is called after a call to RegisterListener, if the function returns null, an empty list or a list which contains an empty or null string then an Invalid Operation exception will be raised.
An instance of this interface can register multiple events.
member.returns: List<string>. List of events which the listener is interested in receiving.

member.name: T:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService
member.summary: This interface is designed to allow callers to register and unregister INotificationListener objects and raise events throughout the system.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.RaiseEvent(System.String@,System.Object@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Raises an event that will be broadcast to all listeners. This method will send the message within the same thread, this could incur slight delays whilst the message is being responded to and should be used only when a response is required for processing purposes.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined result obtained by a listener processing the event.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.RaiseEvent(System.String@,System.Object@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Raises an event that will be broadcast to all listeners. This method will send the message within a separate thread, this ensures there are no delays to the current thread whilst the message is being processed and should be used when no response is required by the class raising the event.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.RaiseEvent(System.String@,System.Object@)
member.summary: Raises an event that will be broadcast to all listeners. This method will send the message within a separate thread, this ensures there are no delays to the current thread whilst the message is being processed and should be used when no response is required by the class raising the event.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.
User defined parameter value, pertinent to the event.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.RaiseEvent(System.String@)
member.summary: Raises an event that will be broadcast to all listeners. This method will send the message within a separate thread, this ensures there are no delays to the current thread whilst the message is being processed and should be used when no response is required by the class raising the event.
member.param: Name of the event being raised.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.RegisterListener(PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener@)
member.summary: Registers an INotificationListener for receiving event notifications.
member.param: INotificationListener instance that is being registered.

member.name: M:PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationService.UnregisterListener(PluginManager.Abstractions.INotificationListener@)
member.summary: Unregisters an INotificationListener class from receiving event notifications.
member.param: INotificationListener instance being unregistered.

member.name: F:PluginManager.Internal.Constants.InvalidListener
member.summary: Exception message used when registering a INotificationListener with the INotificationService message notifications, when the listener does not provide any event names.

member.name: F:PluginManager.Internal.Constants.InvalidEventName
member.summary: Exception message used when registering a INotificationListener with the INotificationService message notifications, when the event name has not been recognised.

member.name: F:PluginManager.Internal.Constants.ThreadNotificationService
member.summary: Name of thread used for INotificationService message notifications

member.name: T:PluginManager.LoggerQueueItem
member.summary:
Log entry item that is held in a queue.
The Plugin Manager keeps the last n log entries in a list, these can be retrieved for viewing.

member.name: M:PluginManager.LoggerQueueItem.#ctor(PluginManager.LogLevel@,System.String@)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Current log level
Log message

member.name: P:PluginManager.LoggerQueueItem.Date
member.summary: Date and time the log entry was made

member.name: P:PluginManager.LoggerQueueItem.Level
member.summary: Log level, the severity or log type for the entry.

member.name: P:PluginManager.LoggerQueueItem.Message
member.summary: The log entry message

member.name: T:PluginManager.PluginSetting
member.summary: Individual plugin module settings, used to define how a plugin is treated by the PluginManager.

member.name: M:PluginManager.PluginSetting.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: M:PluginManager.PluginSetting.#ctor(System.String@)
member.summary: Constructor requesting setting for individual plugin module.
member.param: Name of plugin module whose settings are requested.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSetting.Name
member.summary: Name of the plugin module, i.e. MyPlugin.dll

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSetting.Disabled
member.summary: Indicates whether the plugin module is disabled and will not be loaded.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSetting.PreventExtractResources
member.summary:
Prevents PluginManager from extracting resources from the plugin module.
If true then no resources will be extracted, this can be usefule if the project has been given to a web designer and they are making changes and don't want them overridden.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSetting.ReplaceExistingResources
member.summary:
Prevents PluginManager from replacing resources that have previously been extracted from the plugin module.
If true then no resources will be extracted, this can be usefule if the project has been given to a web designer and they are making changes and don't want them overridden.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSetting.Version
member.summary:
Specifies the specific version number of the plugin to be loaded.
Use this value should multiple copies of the plugin module be within PluginSearchPath

member.name: T:PluginManager.PluginSettings
member.summary: Settings that affect how PluginManager works.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.Disabled
member.summary: Opionally disable plugin manager and prevent it from loading any plugins.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.PluginPath
member.summary: Path where plugin assembly modules are located.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.PluginSearchPath
member.summary: Root path that is used to search for plugin assembly modules.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.SystemFiles
member.summary: Root path that will be searched for dll's that can not be found when loading plugin modules.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.CreateLocalCopy
member.summary: Indicates whether a copy of the plugin will be sent to , where it will be loaded from.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.LocalCopyPath
member.summary: If CreateLocalCopy is true, this path will be used to store and load the plugins from.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.PluginFiles
member.summary:
User defined list of plugin modules that will be loaded in order prior to generic loading of plugins.
If you need to specify the load order of plugins the assembly names (with or without path) need to be included in this list.

member.name: P:PluginManager.PluginSettings.Plugins
member.summary: Individual plugin module settings.
